newsitem.title: UK: GEC Marconi wins 2 bln pound UK submarine order.
newsitem.headline: GEC Marconi wins 2 bln pound UK submarine order.

text.p: Defence Secretary Michael Portillo will announce in the next few days that Britain has given GEC Marconi a two billion pound ($3.2 billion) order for three nuclear-powered submarines, defence sources said on Thursday.
The sources, which asked not to be identified, said the Trafalgar class hunter-killer submarines would be built at GEC's VSEL Barrow shipyard.

The Ministry of Defence said in December 1995 that it had chosen GEC Marconi to build up to five Trafalgar class submarines, but said the deal would only be officially confirmed once agreement had been reached on price.
A spokesman for GEC Marconi declined to comment, saying no official announcement had yet been made.
